content.question: What would be the most profitable location for an ethanol manufacturing plant that converts corn into alcohol for use as an additive for gasoline?

choices.label: Near a large university to facilitate recruitment of highly trained chemists
Near a break-of-bulk point for ease of transportation
Near a navigable river to reduce transportation costs to distant markets
Near a prime corn-producing area to minimize transportation costs of raw materials
Near a large metropolitan area to serve a major market

content.answer: Near a prime corn-producing area to minimize transportation costs of raw materials

unit.text: 7: Industrial and Economic Development Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain spatial relationships in a specified context or region of the world, using geographic concepts, processes, models, or theories.
